main event: On May 1, 1956, Reverend Charles Burmzister reported seeing multiple round objects the size of baseballs, reddish-orange in color, flying in a U-shaped formation over Marinette, Michigan.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately one hour., The objects disappeared over the horizon after traveling on a Northwest-West heading., The observer was an amateur astronomer, indicating they had knowledge of meteors., Initial evaluations suggested the sighting might be astronomical in nature due to the behavior and appearance of the objects., Multiple groups of objects were observed, challenging the meteor hypothesis.
witness description: Reverend Charles Burmzister, a civilian and amateur astronomer
